title: Couple Marries with Separate Properties

scenario_info.name: Couple with Separate Properties Before Marriage
scenario_info.description: Alex and Sam each own a home before they get married. After cohabitation, they can only claim one property as main residence. Alex's property becomes partially taxable.

expected_result.notes: From cohabitation date, couple must choose ONE main residence

applicable_rules: Couples can only claim ONE main residence at any time
From cohabitation (1 Mar 2020), must choose which property is MR
Alex's property: MR for 1,705 days before cohabitation
Alex's property: NOT MR for 1,660 days after cohabitation

property_history.description: Alex moves in with Sam - couple chooses Sam's property as joint MR

properties.notes: Alex's property before marriage. From cohabitation, couple claimed Sam's property as MR, so six-year rule cannot apply here.

property_history.description: Alex moves in - becomes couple's joint main residence

properties.notes: Sam's property - continues as couple's main residence after marriage. Not being sold.

user_query: Alex and Sam each owned a home before getting together. When Alex moved in with Sam in March 2020, they chose Sam's place as their main residence. Alex then rented out and sold the Bulimba property. What is the CGT on Alex's property?
